title: What is Artificial Intelligence?
content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think and learn.

title: What is Machine Learning?
content: Machine Learning (ML) is a subset of AI that enables systems to learn patterns from data without being explicitly programmed.

title: Supervised Learning
content: Supervised learning is a type of ML where the model is trained on labeled data to make predictions.

title: Unsupervised Learning
content: Unsupervised learning trains models on unlabeled data to find hidden patterns or groupings.

title: Reinforcement Learning
content: Reinforcement learning involves training an agent to make sequences of decisions by rewarding desired behaviors.

title: What are Neural Networks?
content: Neural networks are computing systems inspired by the human brain, used for pattern recognition and learning.

title: Deep Learning
content: Deep Learning is a subset of ML that uses multi-layered neural networks to model complex patterns.

title: Natural Language Processing
content: NLP is a branch of AI focused on understanding and generating human language by machines.

title: Tokenization
content: Tokenization is the process of breaking text into smaller units called tokens, like words or subwords.

title: Embeddings
content: Embeddings are numerical vector representations of text or items that capture semantic meaning.

title: Vector Search
content: Vector search retrieves information by comparing embeddings to find the most similar items.

title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation
content: RAG combines vector search with generative models to answer queries using retrieved context.

title: Transformers
content: Transformers are neural network architectures that use attention mechanisms for sequence modeling.

title: Attention Mechanism
content: Attention allows models to focus on relevant parts of input sequences when making predictions.

title: BERT
content: BERT is a transformer-based model for NLP that understands the context of words in a sentence.

title: GPT
content: GPT is a generative transformer model that can generate human-like text based on input prompts.

title: Fine-tuning
content: Fine-tuning adapts pre-trained models to specific tasks by training on task-specific data.

title: Vector Database
content: Vector databases store embeddings and enable fast similarity search for RAG applications.

title: Cosine Similarity
content: Cosine similarity measures the similarity between two vectors based on the angle between them.

title: Use Cases of RAG
content: RAG can be used in chatbots, question answering systems, knowledge bases, and customer support.
